trans-unit.source: Python web app with Django on Mac | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Python web app with Django on Mac | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: A tutorial that shows how to host a Django-based website on Azure using a Linux virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: A tutorial that shows how to host a Django-based website on Azure using a Linux virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Django Hello World Web Application (mac-linux)
trans-unit.target: Django Hello World Web Application (mac-linux)

trans-unit.source: This tutorial describes how to host a Django-based website on Microsoft
trans-unit.target: This tutorial describes how to host a Django-based website on Microsoft

trans-unit.source: Azure using a Linux virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Azure using a Linux virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes you have no prior experience using Azure.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes you have no prior experience using Azure.

trans-unit.source: Upon completing this guide, you will have a Django-based application up and running in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Upon completing this guide, you will have a Django-based application up and running in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: You will learn how to:
trans-unit.target: You will learn how to:

trans-unit.source: Setup an Azure virtual machine to host Django.
trans-unit.target: Setup an Azure virtual machine to host Django.

trans-unit.source: While this tutorial explains how to accomplish this under Linux, the same could also be done with a Windows Server VM hosted in Azure.
trans-unit.target: While this tutorial explains how to accomplish this under Linux, the same could also be done with a Windows Server VM hosted in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Django application from Linux.
trans-unit.target: Create a new Django application from Linux.

trans-unit.source: By following this tutorial, you will build a simple Hello World web
trans-unit.target: By following this tutorial, you will build a simple Hello World web

trans-unit.source: application.
trans-unit.target: application.

trans-unit.source: The application will be hosted in an Azure virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The application will be hosted in an Azure virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: A screenshot of the completed application is below:
trans-unit.target: A screenshot of the completed application is below:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>A browser window displaying the hello world page on Azure</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>A browser window displaying the hello world page on Azure</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Creating and configuring an Azure virtual machine to host Django
trans-unit.target: Creating and configuring an Azure virtual machine to host Django

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions given here[portal-vm] to create an Azure virtual machine of the Ubuntu Server 14.04 LTS distribution.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions given here[portal-vm] to create an Azure virtual machine of the Ubuntu Server 14.04 LTS distribution.

trans-unit.source: Note: you only need to create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Note: you only need to create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Stop at the section titled How to log on to the virtual machine after you create it.
trans-unit.target: Stop at the section titled How to log on to the virtual machine after you create it.

trans-unit.source: Instruct Azure to direct port 80 traffic from the web to port 80 on the virtual machine:
trans-unit.target: Instruct Azure to direct port 80 traffic from the web to port 80 on the virtual machine:

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your newly created virtual machine in the Azure Portal and click the ENDPOINTS tab.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your newly created virtual machine in the Azure Portal and click the ENDPOINTS tab.

trans-unit.source: Click the ADD button at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Click the ADD button at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>add endpoint</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>add endpoint</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Open up the TCP protocol's PUBLIC PORT 80 as PRIVATE PORT 80.
trans-unit.target: Open up the TCP protocol's PUBLIC PORT 80 as PRIVATE PORT 80.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>port80</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>port80</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Setting up the development environment
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Setting up the development environment

trans-unit.source: Note: If you need to install Python or would like to use the Client Libraries, please see the Python Installation Guide.
trans-unit.target: Note: If you need to install Python or would like to use the Client Libraries, please see the Python Installation Guide.

trans-unit.source: The Ubuntu Linux VM already comes with Python 2.7 pre-installed, but it doesn't have Apache or django installed.
trans-unit.target: The Ubuntu Linux VM already comes with Python 2.7 pre-installed, but it doesn't have Apache or django installed.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to connect to your VM and install Apache and django.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to connect to your VM and install Apache and django.

trans-unit.source: Launch a new Terminal window.
trans-unit.target: Launch a new Terminal window.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following command to connect to the Azure VM.
trans-unit.target: Enter the following command to connect to the Azure VM.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following commands to install django:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following commands to install django:

trans-unit.source: Enter the following command to install Apache with mod-wsgi:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following command to install Apache with mod-wsgi:

trans-unit.source: Creating a new Django application
trans-unit.target: Creating a new Django application

trans-unit.source: Open the Terminal window you used in the previous section to ssh into your VM.
trans-unit.target: Open the Terminal window you used in the previous section to ssh into your VM.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following commands to create a new Django project:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following commands to create a new Django project:

trans-unit.source: The django-admin.py script generates a basic structure for Django-based websites:
trans-unit.target: The django-admin.py script generates a basic structure for Django-based websites:

trans-unit.source: helloworld/manage.py helps you to start hosting and stop hosting your Django-based website
trans-unit.target: helloworld/manage.py helps you to start hosting and stop hosting your Django-based website

trans-unit.source: helloworld/helloworld/settings.py contains Django settings for your application.
trans-unit.target: helloworld/helloworld/settings.py contains Django settings for your application.

trans-unit.source: helloworld/helloworld/urls.py contains the mapping code between each url and its view.
trans-unit.target: helloworld/helloworld/urls.py contains the mapping code between each url and its view.

trans-unit.source: Create a new file named views.py in the /var/www/helloworld/helloworld directory.
trans-unit.target: Create a new file named views.py in the /var/www/helloworld/helloworld directory.

trans-unit.source: This will contain the view that renders the "hello world" page.
trans-unit.target: This will contain the view that renders the "hello world" page.

trans-unit.source: Setting up Apache
trans-unit.target: Setting up Apache

trans-unit.source: Create an Apache virtual host configuration file /etc/apache2/sites-available/helloworld.conf.
trans-unit.target: Create an Apache virtual host configuration file /etc/apache2/sites-available/helloworld.conf.

trans-unit.source: Set the contents to the following, and make sure to replace yourVmUrl with the actual URL of the machine you are using (for example pyubuntu.cloudapp.net).
trans-unit.target: Set the contents to the following, and make sure to replace yourVmUrl with the actual URL of the machine you are using (for example pyubuntu.cloudapp.net).

trans-unit.source: Shutting down your Azure virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Shutting down your Azure virtual machine

trans-unit.source: When you're done with this tutorial, shutdown and/or remove your newly created Azure virtual machine to free up resources for other tutorials and avoid incurring Azure usage charges.
trans-unit.target: When you're done with this tutorial, shutdown and/or remove your newly created Azure virtual machine to free up resources for other tutorials and avoid incurring Azure usage charges.
